name: Kitchen Clash!
description:
Introduction

Part of UCI GDIM 32/ICS 167 Final Project, 2022 Winter Quarter.

Four chefs. Four restaurants. One winner. 

Kitchen Clash! is a 2-player, fast-paced, top-down restaurant simulator. Players choose between four diverse chef characters, cook up four delicious meals (burgers, tostadas, bahn mi, and falafel sandwiches), and collect tips from customers. Each day is 3 minutes long; at the end of day 5, the player with the most tips wins. 

Controls Local Left side is always Player 1. Right side is always Player 2. WASD/E for Player 1; Arrow Keys/Period (.) for Player 2.

WASD to move around Player 1.

E to interact: take in/deliver customer orders, pick up/drop ingredients, combine ingredients.

Arrow keys to move around Player 2. 

Period Key (.) to interact: take in/deliver customer orders, pick up/drop ingredients, combine ingredients.

Online Online Only: Characters are chosen randomly. Food sprites are limited to burgers only.  Player who creates the Lobby is P1. Player who joins the Lobby is P2.  Left side is always Player 1. Right side is always Player 2. WASD/E for Player 1; Arrow Keys/Period (.) for Player 2. How To Play

Take orders on the order window, on the lower corner of the screen. 

Make meals according to customer orders. Put the "meat" ingredient on the grill, then combine them with sauce/vegetable ingredients while holding the "bun" ingredient. 

Interact with an empty soda cup in hand with a soda machine to fill up soda. 

Customers will tip based on the timeliness and correctness of the order. "Critics" (customers with a red aura) may also visit the restaurant; they are punishing for incorrect orders but very rewarding for correct and speedy ones. 

Each day lasts 3 minutes. At the end of day 5, the player with the most amount of tips wins. 

Credits Eric Park: Game Designer, UI Designer, Writer. Programmed character select/day system/timer functionality.  Ben Chiaro: Programmed AI functionality and online systems.  Nathan More: Programmed core systems and online functionality.  Tim Kashani: Main composer/sub-artist. Programmed core systems/menus/particle system. Daniel Le: Main Pixel Artist/Concept Artist. Programmed day system/timer functionality.
